or Landing-place; and that the Persons belonging to such Wharfs, Barkadiers, or Landing-places,
shall be, and are hereby required to permit the same : And whosoever shall
offend contrary to the true Intent and Meaning of this Act, shall, for every such
Offence, forfeit the Sum of Forty Shillings ; to be recovered before any Magistrate of the
Parish or Precinct where such Offence is committed.
V. AND be it further enacted by the Authority aforesaid, That within one Month after
the Day of passing this Act, the Fare and Hire of a Wherry with two Oars, between
Port Royal and Kingston, shall be four Ryalls ; and between Port Royal aforesaid and Passage
Fort, the like Sum of four Ryalls ; and between Kingston aforesaid and Passage Fort,
the Sum of six Ryalls; and from Port Royal or Kingston to the several Places following,
the Hire and Fare of such Wherries with two Oars shall be as follows, viz. To St. James's
Fort, five shillings; to Bull Bay, ten Shillings ; to Yallows, twenty Shillings ; to Morant,
or Port Morant, forty Shillings ; to Old Harbour, Pig Bay, the Bogne, or Salt River, one
Pound, and so in Proportion; that is to say, one Half more than the Prices respectively,
as aforesaid, for Wherries with four Oars.
VI. AND be it further enacted by the Authority aforesaid, That such Whereymen, as
aforesaid, shall be, and are hereby obliged to ply from Break of Day to Eight o'Clock
at Night, under the Penalty (if he be a white Man) that he shall forfeit ten Shillings ;
and if he be a Negro, he shall suffer thirty one Lashes, to be ordered respectively by
any Magistrate, before whom Complaint shall be made.
VII. And be it further enacted by the Authority aforesaid, That Weights and Scales
shall be kept by all Owners or Persons employed for the keeping of publick Wharfs,
Barkadiers, Bays, and Landing-places in this Island, to weigh, if required, all Sugar, Indigo,
Piemento, Cotton, and other Plantation Goods, which shall come to such Wharf,
Bay, Barkadier, or Landing-place, and the Weight thereof respectively shall be entered
into a Book at each Place to be kept for that Purpose ; and for such weighing and
entring into such Books, as aforesaid, they shall be paid fifteen Pence for every Hogshead,
and seven Pence Halfpeny for every Draught, be it more or less, of other Goods of all
Sorts which shall be so weighed and entered, as aforesaid : And all Wharfingers and
other Persons which shall receive any Benefit at any such Wharf, Barkadier, or Landing-
place, shall give, or take Care that Receipts be given for all Goods which shall be delivered
to them by any Person demanding the same, such Goods having been first weighed,
as aforesaid: And whosoever shall offend, either by neglecting to procure such Scales
and Weights, or in not weighing the Goods delivered to them, and entering the same
in a Book, as aforesaid, or not giving such Receipts, as aforesaid, upon Demand; every
Person so offending, shall, for every such Offence, forfeit the Sum of Twenty Pounds ;
to be recovered in the Supreme Court of Judicature of this Island, wherein no Essoin,
Protection, or Wager of Law shall be allowed, or Non vult ulterius prosequi be entered;
any Law, Custom, or usage to the contrary notwithstanding.
VIII. And be it further enacted by the Authority aforesaid, That the Owners or Proprietors
of any Hackney Coach or Coaches, Chariots, and four wheel Chaises, which
shall ply upon the Road for Hire, shall have one white Man for each such Hackney
Coach or Coaches, Chariot, or Chaise which shall so ply for Hire; and the Hire and
Fare shall be as follows, viz. For each Coach to and from Passage Fort to Spanish Town
and back again, that carries four Passengers, thirty Shillings; for each Coach that carries
three Passengers, five and twenty Shillings; and for two Passengers, or for one
Passenger in any such Hackney Coach, Chariot, or Chaise, twenty Shillings, and no
more.
IX. And be it further enacted by the Authority aforesaid, That the Owners of all
Carts or Waines that shall carry Goods for Hire, shall be obliged to keep one white Man
for the First Cart or Waine, and one white Man more for every two such Carts or Waines
they shall keep besides the first, to go forwards and backwards with such Carts and Waines ;
and that the Fare and Hire for such Cart and Waine shall be as follows, viz. For each
Hogshead of Sugar, five Shillings ; for each Barrel of Beef, Flour, Herrings, or
Mackarel, the Sum of one Shilling and three Pence, and so in Proportion for Carriage of other
Goods from Spanish Town to Passage Fort, and no more.
X. AND the owner of each such Hackney Coach, Chariot, or Chaise, as aforesaid,
and of each Cart and Waine, or some Person for him or her, shall give in an Account
upon Oath at each Session of the Number of Hackney Coaches, Chariots, Chaises, Carts,
and Waines which they keep respectively, and of the Names of the white Man or Men
particularly kept for each Hackney Coach, Chariot, Chaise, Cart or Carts, Waine or
Waines ; which Oath the Justices at each Session are hereby impowered to administer
and receive : And whosoever shall offend contrary to the Intent of this Act, either in
not keeping such white Man for each such Coach or Coaches, Chariot, Chaises, Cart or
Waine, or in not making such Oath, for every such Offence shall forseit the Sum of
